alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 16 at 9:32PM CDT until May 17 at 9:30AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Lake Creek at Sendera Ranch Road affecting Montgomery County. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Sendera Ranch Road... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lake Creek at Sendera Ranch Road. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 140.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 AM CDT Tuesday was 143.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 140.7 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 138.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 141.8 feet on 03/30/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (10 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Lake Creek Sendera Ranch Roa 138.0 140.5 Tue 6 am CDT 135.6 132.2 129.9 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 930 AM CDT.
